subject: Re: [junit] How to get fixture from TestSetup
msgSnippet: Not to steal J.B. s flame, but I think this is what you may be looking for: import junit.extensions.TestSetup; import junit.framework.Test; public class
messageBody:
Not to steal J.B.'s flame, but I think this is what you may be looking for:

import junit.extensions.TestSetup;
import junit.framework.Test;

public class MyTestSetup extends TestSetup {
public MyTestSetup(Test aTest) {
super(aTest);
}
public void setUp() {
...do your one time setUp
}
public void tearDown() {
...do your one time tearDown
}
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(new MyTestSetup(<TestCase>);
return suite;
}
}

Add a main(String[]) if you aren't using an IDE inte*great*ed JUnit.

-jason
--- Todd Jonker <tvj@...> wrote:
> Hello, I'm trying to figure out how to properly use TestSetup, but the
> documentation is very sparse and I've found no help on the mailing list
> archive.
>
> I understand how to wrap the appropriate TestCases inside a TestSetup, so
> that the setUp method in the wrapper is called only once for the entire set
> of TestCases.
>
> Presumably, that method (eg MyTestSetup.setUp) will initialize some fixture
> and store in in member variables.
>
> Now how do my nested TestCase instances access that common fixture? I see
> no way to access it, and can't find any sample code that does it.
>
>
> Thanks for your help,
